data.title: OSB 505 Christina Pickles of "St Elsewhere" by On Screen & Beyond
data.meta_description: Episode 505 Christina Pickles joins us to talk about her 2018 Emmy nomination for her role as "Biz" in the hilarious webseries "Break A Hip"!  She is an Emmy and Tony winner and we have seen here in many roles including on "St Elsewhere",  and as Ross and Monica's mom on "Friends"! A great guest! Plus, we check out "Hustlers", "Flarsky" and more, on this week's On Screen and Beyond!
data.text:
Episode 700 of On Screen & Beyond brings Emmy winner Eric Braeden of "The Young & The Restless" as our guest! Eric has played the role of Victor Newman for over 44 years, as well as having had roles in "Titanic", "Escape From The Planet of The Apes", "The Rat Patrol" and over one hundred guest starring roles on some of the most popular TV shows over the last five decades! Eric shares fun memories of his career with us!

Episode 699 of On Screen & Beyond brings back Simon Phillips to the OSB mic! Simon was last here talking about his role on "FUBAR" and this time he joins us to talk about his latest film "The Mouse Trap", a throwback to the 80's and 90's slasher movies...with a twist! Simon is always bringa a fun chat to OSB!

Episode 698 of On Screen & Beyond brings Charlotte Kirk to the OSB mic. Charlotte shares with us about her latest film "Duchess" which includes and incredible cast that takes us on a wild ride!

Episode 697 of On Screen & Beyond continues with part 2 of our past interview with Jack Larson who was Jimmy Olsen on "Adventures of Superman"! Jack gave us a behind the scenes look at the popular show of The Man of Steel.

Episode 696 of On Screen & Beyond brings back our past interview with Jack Larson, "Jimmy Olsen" on "Adventures of Superman"! Jack shared memories of the cast of the show including George Reeves. Don't miss this interview!

Episode 695 of On Screen & Beyond has Michael Learned returning for another chat! This time she talks her new movie "Our Crossroads" as well as her most famous role as Olivia Walton on the classic TV show "The Waltons" and more! Always a pleasure when Michael joins us!

Episode 694 of On Screen & Beyond - Misha Crosby and John Mawson are the creators, directors and showrunners of the audio movie "Unsinkable" premiering July 10th on Wondery + with and incerdibe cast including Brian Cox of "Succession", John Malkovich, Harry Hamlin and more!

On Screen & Beyond Episode 693 brings Dean Butler, Almanzo Wilder from "Little House On The Prairie" back as our guest! Dean talks about the show on this year of it's 50th Anniversary, his book, Michael Landon and more!

On Screen & Beyond Episode 692 has John Ford Coley as our guest! In the 70's he was half of the singing duo "England Dan & john Ford Coley" and gave us the hits "Nights Are Forever Without You", "I'd Really Love To See You Tonight", "Love Is The Answer" and more! John is out on tour and still bringing us great songs!

Episode 691 of On Screen & Beyond - Jason Butler Harner drops by to talk about his career and his latest film "Edge of Everything". Jason is known for his roles in "The Walking Dead", "Ozark", "Ray Donovan", "Rabbit Hole" and currently in "Sugar", "Clipped" and the upcoming "Monsters: The Lyle & Eric Menendez Story".

Episode 690 of On Screen & Beyond - Samantha Sloyan ("Grey's Anatomy", "Midnight Mass") and Ward Roberts ("Westworld", "Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.") join us to chat about their latest sci-fi comedy "Invaders From Proxima B". Join us for a fun chat!

Episode 689 of On Screen & Beyond takes us back to 1976 with Bruce Blackman of the group "Starbuck" who gave us the hit song "Moonlight Feels Right". Bruce shares how they came up with the band's name, the story behind the song and so much more!

Episode 688 of On Screen & Beyond - Annette O'Toole Joins us to talk about "We Go On: Remastered", in which she co-stars. She also talks about her early career, "Virgin River" and more! Her career started at the age of two and there has been mo stopping her since.

On Screen & Beyond Episode 687 guest Jerry Buckner takes us back to 1982 and his top 10 hit song "Pac Man Fever"! Jerry was half of the group Buckner & Garcia, who wrote and gave us that hit! But Jerry has done so much more, from producing and writing hits for others and much more!

Episode 686 of On Screen & Beyond - Actress Bern Nadette Stanis, who played Thelma Evans of the hit TV show "Good Times" drops by to talk about the show on it's 50th Anniversary. She also lets us in on her memoir coming out this fall and much more!

Episode 685 of On Screen & Beyond has Tennis Legend Stan Smith and Danny Lee, director and producer of the documentary "Who Is Stan Smith". Stan won the US Open Tennis Championship and Wimbledon and is one of Tennis's noteable greats. He is also known for the sneaker named after him and so much more!

Episode 684 of On Screen & Beyond bring Singer/Songwiter David Paton, lead singer and founder of the 70's band "Pilot" as our guest. David wrote the hit song "Magic", which is now used in the commercials for Ozempic. He also worked with Elton John, The Alan Parsons Project, sang on "Mull of Kintyre" with Paul McCartney and much more! Fascinating guest!

On Screen & Beyond Episode 683 brings the writer, director and co-star of "Rockbottom" as our guest. Todd shares news about the comedy film, which will bring back the 80's hairbands to us. Lots of fun and news with Todd.

Episode 682 of On Screen & Beyond has Baby Grace from "Little House On The Prairie" as we enter its 50th Anniversary on television! Wendi talks about her four seasons on the classic show, her books and so much more!

Episode 680 of On Screen & Beyond has the music trio ICYDAY as our guest! Issac Cohen, Sloane Morgan Siegel and David Bloom make up the band! Sloane is known for his starring roles in "Dwight In Shining Armor" and "Gortimer Gibbon's Life On Normal Street", while David has also been on "Gortimer..." and in "Wierd: The Al Yankovic Story" and Issac has been involved in music hos whole life. Together they form ICYDAY and they bring us som great music!

Episode 679 of On Screen & Beyond - Multi-talented John Davidson joins us in this episode! John hosted "Hollywood Squares", co-hosted "That's Incredible", was in the film "The Happiest Millionaire", co-starred on "The Girl With Something Extra" with Sally Field, been on Broadway and more! He spends the summers singing and performing for audiences in New Hampshire these days.

Episode 678 of On Screen & Beyond brings us Will Glover of the 60's Surf Band "The Pyramids"! Their hit "Penetration" swept them on to Dick Clark's American Bandstand and into the movie "Bikini Beach" with Frankie & Annette and so much more! Will shares stories of the past and what he is up to now!

Episode 676 of On Screen & Beyond has Scott Valentine of "Family Ties" fame as our guest. Scott talks about his time on "Family Ties" and his latest project, the new streaming service Red Coral Universe.

Episode 675 of On Screen & Beyond heads into some good old rock & roll with Jim Peterik, co-founder of the bands The Ides of March and the band Survivor! Jim has written or co-written many hit songs including "Vehicle" in the 70's, "Eye of the Tiger", "High On You", "Burning Heart", "Hold On Loosely" and so many other hits! He has won a Grammy and was nominated for an Oscar. Get ready for a fascinating chat!

Episode 674 of On Screen & Beyond has Michelle Krusiec as our guest to talk about her latest movie "Float" from Lionsgate. Michelle is was in the limited series "Hollywood", "Fringe", "ER" and so much more!

Episode 673 of On Screen & Beyond has Linda Purl as our guest. Linda was Fonzie's girlfriend on "Happy Days" and starred in the TV show "Robin's Hoods", is a singer and so much more.

Episode 672 of On Screen & Beyond has Patrick Duffy of "Dallas" as our guest. He played the role of Bobby Ewing. Patrick is also known for "Step By Step", "The Man From Atlantis", "The Bold and the Beautiful" and more!

Episode 671 0f On Screen & Beyond has Kurt Yaeger (Sons of Anarchy) as our guest. He joins us to talk about his latest film "SUNRISE" from Lionsgate. He shares stories of working with Guy Pearce and more!

Episode 670 of On Screen & Beyond has Alex Pettyfer joining us! Alex is known for his roles in "Magic Mike", "Elvis & Nixon", "Lee Daniel's The Butler" and more! He joins us to talk about his latest film from Lionsgate, "Sunrise" with Guy Pearce.

Episode 669 of On Screen & Beyond has the cast and director of the Slamdance Film Festival World Premiere movie BLISS joining us. Director Joe Maggio and stars Clint Jordan and Faryl Amadeus are our guests. They share behind the scenes stories of the film and more.

On Screen & Beyond episode 668 has Pro Wrestler Chris Jericho as our guest. Chris has been in the ring, in movies, on TV, and is the Executive Producer of the new documentary "The Death Tour" with the World Premiere happening on January 19, 2024 at the Slamdance Film Festival in Park City, Utah. Chris shares insight into the film and more!

Episode 667 of On Screen & Beyond - We sit down and chat with Andrew Davis, director of many films including "The Fugitive" with Harrison Ford and Tommy Lee Jones, "Collateral Damage", "Holes", "Under Siege", "Stony Island" and so many others!

Episode 666 of On Screen & Beyond - We have James Camali director of "The Mental State" along with cast members William R Moses, who we know from his long run on "Falcon Crest" and Alison Thorton! They talk about the making of this thought provoking film.

Episode 665 of On Screen & Beyond takes a musical turn this week with our guests The Cowsills! Bob, Paul and Susan, The Cowsills join us to talk about their music including "Hair", "The Rain, The Park and Other Things", touring, being the inspiration for the TV show "The Partridge Family" and so much more. We also talk about their new Christmas EP "A Christmas Offering From The Cowsills"!

Episode 664 of On Screen & Beyond has as our guest Soul Music Hall of Famer Shelly Clark , co-founder of the R & B group The Honey Cone! The gave us the number one hits "Want Ads" and "Stick Up", along with the top 40 hit "One Monkey Don't Stop No Show" and other hits! Shelly has been back on tour and she talks about other projects she has worked on over the years!

On Screen & Beyond Episode 663 has as our guest, Rick Cosnett of "The Flash", "Quantico", "The Vampire Diaries" and more joining us! Rick talks about his career, his new movie "Shoulder Dance" and more!

Episode 662 of On Screen & Beyond brings actor Alex Hyde-White to the OSB mic. Alex has been in "Pretty Woman", "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade", "Battlestar Galactica" and so much more. He shares stories of his career and "The Fantastic Four"!

Episode 661 of On Screen & Beyond has actress Kathy Garver of the classic TV show "Family Affair" joining us, but not to talk about that show, rather her work on westerns and being honored with a Silver Spur Award for that work! Kathy is always a wonderful guest with great stories.

On Screen & Beyond episode 660 has Hollywood Historian and author joining us once again to talk about people, places and things in Hollywood that are haunted! Her book "Hollywood Haunted" has been released once again with more spooky stories, more pictures and more! Let's turn off the lights and hear about stars from the past and their ghostly encounters!

Episode 659 of On Screen & Beyond takes us back to "The New Zoo Revue with stars & co-creator of the beloved kids show! Doug & Emmy Jo Momary drop by to share memories of the making of "The New Zoo Revue" as well as their special guests and so much more!

Episode 658 of On Screen & Beyond takes us back 45 years to the start of the classic TV show "Taxi"! Randall Carver joins us! Randall was one of the original cast members of the show, playing the role of driver John Burns. Randall also talks about his role in the Oscar winning movie "Midnight Cowboy" and much more!

Episode 655 of On Screen & Beyond brings Judith Kahan to the OSB mic! Judith was a writer and actress, she was on stage and in "Multiplicity", "All's Fair", "Valerie", "Ferris Bueller" and more! She shares working with Dick Van Dyke and others!

Episode 654 of On Screen & Beyond brings actor Frankie Faison to the OSB mic! Frankie is known for his roles on "The Wire", "Banshee", "Coming To America", "The Rookie: Feds", Do The Right Thing" and so much more! He shares his latest project with us, "Frankies Fabulous Granola"!

Episode 653 of On Screen & Beyond has Emmy nominated writer Shelley Herman is our guest this week. She wrote for many game shows including "Love Connection" and "Supermarket Sweep". As a Page for NBC she meet many legends Bob Hope, Jimmy Stewart, Alfred Hitchcock, Johnny Carson and more. She shares stories of meeting them with us and more in her book "My Peacock Tale: Secrets of an NBC Page"!

Episode 652 of On Screen & Beyond is our first episode of Season 17 and our special guest is actor/writer/producer Steven Kampmann! Steven joins us to talk about his career producing and writing for "WKRP in Cincinnati", writing "Back To School", co-starring on "Newhart" as Kirk Devane and so much more! He also talks of his podcast dealing with his dream course!

Episode 651 of On Screen & Beyond celebrates the 20th anniversary of "Pirate of the Carribean" with Vince Lozano who played Jacoby, one of the pirates on the Black Pearl. Vince shares stories of the making of the film as well as his career and his latest movie "Trauma Therapy Psycosis".
